revised_title: Paramagnetic Resonance Spectra of Rare-Earth Double Nitrates
tldr: The authors analyzed the paramagnetic resonance spectra of praseodymium, neodymium, and samarium magnesium nitrates at low temperatures. They observed anisotropic spectroscopic splitting factors and hyperfine structures in the spectra. The nuclear hyperfine structure was responsible for the principal contribution to the specific heat of each salt. The study provides insights into the magnetic properties and crystal lattice behavior of rare-earth double nitrates.
